meanings.definition: The state of glowing with heat
meanings.sent1: The candescence of the fire warmed the room.
meanings.sent2: The metal reached a bright candescence under the intense heat.
meanings.sent3: The candescence of the stove made the kettle whistle happily.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks flushed with a candescence that matched the setting sun.
meanings.sent5: The candescence of the bonfire lit up the night sky.

meanings.sent2: The blacksmith carefully observed the metal's candescence as it heated up.
meanings.sent3: The candescence of the fireflies in the garden mesmerized the children.
meanings.sent4: The candescence of the idea sparked a wave of creativity in the team.
meanings.sent5: The candescence of dawn slowly illuminated the dark sky.

meanings.definition: The quality of being white or glowing with heat
meanings.sent1: The candescence of the snow-covered landscape was breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: The candescence of the stars in the night sky was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent3: The candescence of the moonlight turned the garden into a magical place.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a candescence that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The candescence of the lighthouse guided ships safely to shore.
